channel.title: Primitive Flail :o (V3 Finished)
channel.description:
Ok, I have decided to make an actual (hopefully at least decent) primitive model. It won't be anything big, but it will be something that [i]should[/i] be able to work in a 317 server. I probably won't finish it tonight, but tomorrow it should be done. I'll post some progress pictures too.
7/31/09, 10:42 P.M. -- Tired. [IMG]http://i97.photobucket.com/albums/l214/lionray/Progresspic1.png[/img]
8/01/09, 11:24 A.M. -- Woke up late, but finished V1 [IMG]http://i97.photobucket.com/albums/l214/lionray/Progresspic2.png[/img] [IMG]http://i97.photobucket.com/albums/l214/lionray/Pflailrender.png[/img]
8/01/09, 11:28 P.M. -- Tired. Finished V2 [IMG]http://i97.photobucket.com/albums/l214/lionray/PrimFlail2.png[/img] [IMG]http://i97.photobucket.com/albums/l214/lionray/PFlailRender2.png[/img]
8/02/09, 10:19 A.M. -- Finished V3, Emphasized Flail's Spikes. [IMG]http://i97.photobucket.com/albums/l214/lionray/ProgressPic3.png[/img] [IMG]http://i97.photobucket.com/albums/l214/lionray/PFlailRender3.png[/img]
More coming soon! :)

item.title: Primitive Flail :o (V3 Finished)
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:11, topic:292205”][quote author=rip4d link=topic=386058.msg2894709#msg2894709 date=1249140574]
Finished V1
And don’t worry Archer, I’ll eventually start with that. I was only getting the hang of basic prim modeling at this point, and i think i got the hang of it already too. I think i might actually prim model from now on, as i have taken a liking to it.
[/quote]
Yea it can be very impressive when using prims. I would like to see someone acually do good with it besides Dylan.[/quote]
My 3ds models?

On topic: I think the handle shouild be thinner. But i love it other than that

Read full topic

@rip4d wrote:

Finished V1
And don’t worry Archer, I’ll eventually start with that. I was only getting the hang of basic prim modeling at this point, and i think i got the hang of it already too. I think i might actually prim model from now on, as i have taken a liking to it.

item.title: Primitive Flail :o (V3 Finished)
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

He might have meant move away from stacking primitives on top of each other, in which case he would be right. When you start with a primitive and extrude, bevel, cut, crease, ect you are doing what is called object modeling which is what you should do after awhile. I am only agreeing with him if thats what he meant.

Read full topic

item.title: Primitive Flail :o (V3 Finished)
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Ok, thanks Dylan I think I’m getting the hang of prims now anyway, and might use them more often

Read full topic

item.title: Primitive Flail :o (V3 Finished)
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“Buddy_budster, post:2, topic:292205”]very nice, good job. for a primative modle i find this quite good. although in the future i encourage you too move away from primatives and more towards making your own. for a start this is very good though. take my advice and you will be well respected as a model maker.

Buddy[/quote]
what the F**K are you talking about? Primitive modelling is the base of ALL 3D animation. Trace method came after. Most professional modellers do not trace/draw as the mesh ends up messy and not clean. it make ALOT more sense to model through primitive method for high poly, high detail, or atleast ive found it to be. you must learn your shit, as JJones said. Dont even respond to other peoples models. i dont want to have them take your incorrect advice and do things wrong. Rip4D do not listen to this. keep primitive modelling and ill teach you how to use blender efficiently.

Read full topic

item.title: Primitive Flail :o (V3 Finished)
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

[quote=“Buddy_budster, post:2, topic:292205”]very nice, good job. for a primative modle i find this quite good. although in the future i encourage you too move away from primatives and more towards making your own. for a start this is very good though. take my advice and you will be well respected as a model maker.

Buddy[/quote]
Buddy, you have no idea what you are talking about. The most respected modellers are primitive modellers. Dont give advice untill you are certain it is effective, and dont give modelling advice untill you know how to at least recolor…

JJones

Read full topic

item.title: Primitive Flail :o (V3 Finished)
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

its ok. keep practicing and eventually you’ll get as good as me. keep prim. modelling, id love to see someone besides me do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Primitive Flail :o (V3 Finished)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Buddy_budster, post:2, topic:292205”]very nice, good job. for a primative modle i find this quite good. although in the future i encourage you too move away from primatives and more towards making your own. for a start this is very good though. take my advice and you will be well respected as a model maker.

Buddy[/quote]
Hmm, after the models that Dylan has made with 99.9% primitives, I encourage primitives if you can get the hang of it. It is just hard to start with and hard to get used to.

Read full topic
